title: Jack Purdue
text:
Jack Purdue (born 20 November 1999) is a <a href="Scotland">Scottish</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er who plays as an <a href="Midfielder%23Attacking%20midfielder">attacking midfielder</a>.
Career.
Greenock Morton.
Purdue joined <a href="Greenock%20Morton%20F.C.">Greenock Morton</a>'s Youth Academy from Gourock YAC in November 2014, and he made his development team breakthrough in September 2015. He signed a full-time contract in May 2016 to tie him to Morton until summer 2018. He made his professional debut as substitute on 24 February 2018 away to <a href="Inverness%20Caledonian%20Thistle%20F.C.">Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.</a> in a 2-0 Morton win. In May 2018, Purdue signed on for a further season at Morton after scoring the winning penalty to secure the Development League West title for 2017-18. He was released by Morton in May 2019.
Queen's Park.
Purdue signed for <a href="Queen%27s%20Park%20F.C.">Queen's Park</a> in July 2019. He made his debut for Queen's in a 0-0 draw v <a href="Hamilton%20Academical%20F.C.">Hamilton Academical</a> on 13 July 2019 in the <a href="Scottish%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a>.
Purdue scored his first senior goal in a 2-2 draw with <a href="Airdrieonians%20F.C.">Airdrieonians</a> on 24 July 2019 in the League Cup. In a season of firsts Purdue also scored his first league goal, in a 2-1 win v <a href="Edinburgh%20City%20F.C.">Edinburgh City</a> on 30 November 2019 in <a href="Scottish%20League%20Two">Scottish League Two</a>. He signed for <a href="East%20Stirlingshire%20F.C.">East Stirlingshire</a> on loan on 21 February 2020 until the end of the season, which was curtailed by the covid-19 pandemic.
Annan Athletic.
<a href="Annan%20Athletic%20F.C.">Annan Athletic</a> announced the signing of Purdue on 3 October 2020. On 25 January 2022, Purdue was released from his contract.
Honours.
Morton
